South Patenga () is Ward No. 41 of Chattogram City Corporation and is under the jurisdiction of Patenga Thana, Bangladesh. It is part of the Chittagong-11 parliamentary constituency and is located in the southwestern part of the city, bordering the Karnaphuli River and the Bay of Bengal.
Demographics
According to the 2011 Census of Bangladesh, the total population of South Patenga Ward is 44,084, comprising 23,256 males and 20,828 females. There are a total of 8,586 households.
Location and Boundaries
South Patenga Ward is located in the southwestern part of Chittagong City Corporation. It is bounded by North Patenga Ward No. 40 to the north, the Karnaphuli River and Bara Uthan Union, Karnaphuli Upazila to the east, the Karnaphuli River and Bairag Union, Anwara Upazila to the south, and North Patenga Ward No. 40 and the Bay of Bengal to the west.
Administration
South Patenga is Ward No. 41 under Chittagong City Corporation and falls under the jurisdiction of Patenga Thana. It is part of Chittagong-11 (Constituency 288) in the national parliamentary elections.
Notable neighborhoods in this ward include:
*	Chowdhuripara
*	Nazirpara
*	Porapara
*	BNA
*	Laldiar Char
*	South Port
Education
The literacy rate of South Patenga Ward is 69.4% according to the 2011 Census. The ward has 1 college, 2 madrasas, 2 secondary schools, and 9 primary schools.
